summary: This is an email forwarding a proposed redaction filing from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to Judge Nathan in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It shows the defense's request to modify a protective order and includes the names of legal personnel involved.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Sends the email attaching Ghislaine Maxwell's proposed redactions to a request and reply regarding modifying a protective order.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Requested that the proposed redactions be sent to Judge Nathan on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell; her defense team is submitting proposed redactions to modify a protective order.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the proposed redactions are being submitted.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) on the internal email regarding the proposed redactions.

persons.name: Ann Lundberg
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) on the internal email regarding the proposed redactions.

connections.description: Pagliuca is acting as defense attorney for Maxwell, requesting the submission of proposed redactions on her behalf.
Simmons sends the email at Pagliuca's request, indicating a working relationship within the defense legal team.
Menninger is cc'd on the internal defense team email regarding Maxwell's case, indicating her involvement as defense counsel.

events.title: Submission of Proposed Redactions
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team submits proposed redactions to a request and reply in support of modifying a protective order in her criminal case.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated August 24, 2020, regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (docket 20 Cr. 330).
Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, including Jeffrey S. Pagliuca, is seeking to modify a protective order in the case.
The defense submitted proposed redactions to a 'Request and Reply in Support of Modifying the Protective Order' filed under seal.
The correspondence shows active legal maneuvering by Maxwell's defense approximately two months after her arrest in July 2020.
